channel.title: TOR circuit switched off
channel.description:
I don't understand what happened at the TOR circuit. Although the workstation works properly by performing an ipcheck. I tried from the gateway terminal to verify connectivity with a Clearnet Connectivity test with the following command:
sudo -u clearnet UWT_DEV_PASSTHROUGH=1 curl --tlsv1.2 --proto =https -H 'Host: check.torproject.org' -k https://138.201.14.212
the answer is the following: Sorry. You are not using Tor.
the workstation works properly despite this answer, I don't understand what happened? ![whonix%20err|690x432](upload://5CFL5mm34GchkhJbKhnUEL9dXSY.png)

item.title: TOR circuit switched off
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
sheep:

Looks like a problem with launching onioncitcuits from the tor control panel. I get that too, but when launching onionciruits directly from the menu, all the circuits are visible.

//cc @troubadour

Read full topic

item.title: TOR circuit switched off
item.dc:creator: sheep
item.description:
Looks like a problem with launching onioncitcuits from the tor control panel. I get that too, but when launching onionciruits directly from the menu, all the circuits are visible.

Read full topic

item.title: TOR circuit switched off
item.dc:creator: mikelosat
item.description:
Ok, thanks for the answer, I don’t understand why I don’t see the onion circuits on the gateway interface anymore, while before I saw everything.

Test GATEWAY :

Read full topic

item.title: TOR circuit switched off
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Use:

whonixcheck --leak-tests

See also:

Whonix

Dev/Leak Tests

Testing for IP/DNS Leaks

Quote https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Controller#Nyx_FAQ

Should any of the following nyx messages concern me?

No; see below for reasons why. See also: “Am I Compromised?” FAQ entry.|

Am I compromised? Does nyx report leaks?

Nyx is conceptually not a tool to discover serious issues such as a possible compromise or leaks. [3]|

mikelosat:

sudo -u clearnet UWT_DEV_PASSTHROUGH=1 curl --tlsv1.2 --proto =https -H ‘Host: check.torproject.org’ -k https://138.201.14.212

the answer is the following: Sorry. You are not using Tor.

Sounds ok, no? Of course, clearnet. Not Tor. What else would you expect?
Running a connectivity check command as user clearnet on the gateway…

Read full topic

item.title: TOR circuit switched off

item.description:
I don’t understand what happened at the TOR circuit. Although the workstation works properly by performing an ipcheck. I tried from the gateway terminal to verify connectivity with a Clearnet Connectivity test with the following command:

sudo -u clearnet UWT_DEV_PASSTHROUGH=1 curl --tlsv1.2 --proto =https -H ‘Host: check.torproject.org’ -k https://138.201.14.212

the answer is the following: Sorry. You are not using Tor.

the workstation works properly despite this answer, I don’t understand what happened?
